title: Development Manager- Integrated Sports
job_detail:
At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.

The Manger, Development – Sports & NHL is responsible for driving media sales growth across all platforms through the creation of integrated solutions for our partners (agencies and advertisers) and strategic sponsorship opportunities for the western market.

This role will be part of but not limited to the Rogers Sports Sales team reporting directly to Director, Integrated Sales – Sports & NHL and is based in Vancouver B.C. This role will also work cross-functionally to support various sales teams across Rogers Media. This individual will help conceive ideas, gather assets, create engaging sales material and support sales in presenting solutions to agencies and advertisers. They must understand Sportsnet’ s content, rights and how we can monetize all available platforms within the boundaries of secured agreements. They must establish productive relationships with internal Sportsnet areas, including Content, Media Planning Inventory and Consumer Marketing. They should model an energetic, positive attitude that helps build and foster a “winning team” environment.

Responsibilities:

Planning and Strategy

  • Work with Content, Marketing & Brand and MPI on annual sales plans for all properties across the various platforms.
  • Evaluate and translate property rights across platforms into selling guidelines by property in tandem with MPI team.
  • Manage and maintain annual sales calendar with go-to-market timelines.
  • Conduct semi-annual competitive analysis on best practices in branded content/media from around the world – with emphasis on sports properties.
  • Provide initiative on new and existing business opportunities
  • Ensure timely and accurate information is distributed to sales relevant group(s)

Outbound Initiatives

  • Responsible to create/build/complete “market ready” outbound integrated/multi-platform customer-ready proposals & roadshows with a specific focus on the western market,
  • Ensure outbound opportunity planning and execution cycle is aligned to customer planning and buying windows.
  • Work closely with MPI, Consumer Insights, Marketing, Production and other areas to ensure Sportsnet delivers compelling opportunities to our customers.
  • Become the voice of sales & customer with internal groups - ensuring pricing, packaging and content integration will align with market needs/planning.

Inbound RFPs

  • Responsible for the creative response for all qualified Sportsnet “RFP’s” (request for proposal).
  • This includes ideation (concept creation), preparation of the proposal including the marketing of the proposal.
  • Must prioritize all RFP’s and set up appropriate meetings and brainstorms with the internal groups.
  • Summarizes creative concepts and seek approval from content leads and work with MPI on pricing and category concerns.
  • Develop supporting work-back schedules and mock-ups to help provide a “turn-key” solution for our customers.
  • Create the final customer PowerPoint presentation/sales materials, ensuring customer objectives are met, creative concepts are articulated clearly and include supporting research/creative/sales tools (if required).
  • Be available to present the final solution with sales lead as required.

Reporting and Analysis

  • Maintain revenue tracking by against each “outbound” property as deals close.
  • Track of all in-bound RFPs with details including customer, deal revenue, annual increase (if applicable) and other feedback.
  • Provides post-analysis of key outbound and inbound customer programs

Other Responsibilities

  • Travel to various client meetings, onsite production, client hosting and etc. as needed
  • Schedule regular reporting meetings and updates with the Director, Integrated Sales – Sports & NHL
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Core Competencies: Customer Focus; Teamwork; Communication; Accountability; Innovation.
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma
  • 4-6 years of related work experience in an integrated sales and sponsorship marketing capacity
  • Knowledge of MS Office applications
  • Able to multi-task in a fast paced environment
  • Highly motivated individual with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills

title: Angular Developer
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference. That’s Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters. This role will be primarily based Downtown but may expand to Brampton office.

We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript and either love or are willing to try a long term relationship with Angular.js or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other JavaScript frameworks from time to time. You ideally believe that single page applications are the future of Digital and are eager to work with server side developers to ensure they produce well designed REST services for you to consume. We strongly value deep technical skills, an eye for UI design and UX intuition, willingness to learn, and desire to work in an intensive, highly productive environment.

Primary Function:

Develop interactive web applications (in a CMS or single page applications) that include browse, shop and self-service functions and customer friendly capabilities. A key responsibility is to use your creativity to produce highly responsive and enjoyable web-based user interfaces. The customer should never be confused about what is happening or become frustrated because they don’t know what to do next.

Detailed Responsibilities include:

- Creating highly interactive single page applications using Angular.js and React.js that respond to all user actions in fractions of a second

- Creating attractive experiences in content management that delight and inspire the customer

- Creating, maintaining, debugging and optimizing JavaScript, HTML and CSS

- Taking an active role in structuring our single page applications to make them easy to maintain and to ensure they are highly modularized

- Creating optimized HTML, CSS and JavaScript with breakpoints that work well on mobile browsers

- Working closely the architects and back end services team to ensure that that we have a useful set of REST services

- Working closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of single page applications and development frameworks so that they produce usable designs

Qualifications

- A university degree in arts, design, engineering, science, math or computer science is highly desirable

- Experience in JavaScript, jQuery, CSS 3, and HTML 5 and in optimizing for fast rendering

- 5+ years experience in building mobile responsive pages with JavaScript frameworks

- Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc)

- Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus

- Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills

- You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience

- Strong organizational and estimation skills

- Exceptional communications and presentation skills

title: Senior Director, The Shopping Channel
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

The Shopping Channel is a division of Rogers Broadcasting Limited (a subsidiary of Rogers Media Inc.)

The Shopping Channel is currently seeking an experienced and dynamic leader to fill the role of Senior Director, IT. Reporting to the VP Media IT, you will be responsible for all items related to IT as TSC including: strategy, solution development, broadcast engineering and operations, project execution, technical implementation, and IT operations and support. You will be responsible for developing and implementing a number of IT solutions that generate to the overall business’s goals of achieving its expected revenue growth and cost efficiencies. In addition, the incumbent is responsible for addressing operational challenges which are related to aging and costly IT infrastructure, PCI compliance and legacy application systems.

Primary Accountabilities:

· Develop and implement strategic and operational plan for TSC Technology

· Deliver Opex and Capex target

· Ensure efficient, stable and secure TSC IT and Broadcast Technology systems

· Manage delivery of TSC technology related initiatives

· Develop talent and promote employee engagement

· Communicate and promote both the ITS and TSC goals and objectives

Specific Tasks:

· Develop and deliver mid-long term TSC IT Strategy and roadmap and ensure alignment with overall ITS technology strategy

· Ensure that IT Operations is in alignment with TSC business requirements

· Deliver in-year and longer term technology initiatives

· Deliver on Opex and Capex budget

· Deliver on Opex efficiencies

· Deliver on capitalized labour targets

· Proactive management of TSC applications

· Develop application upgrade path for legacy systems

· Immediate response, resolution and communication

· Govern execution of TSC IT initiatives

· Ensure requirements are clear and managed effectively

· Support teams and remove road blocks on programs

· Manage talent and performance for direct reports

· Support personal development plans

· Promote ITS goals and objectives and benefits to TSC

· Communicate / educate TSC SLT on ITS processes and procedures

In order to be considered for this role you must possess the following qualifications and experiences:

· A seasoned leader with an Undergraduate degree in Business, Technology, Engineering; Master’s degree is highly desirable with 10+ years in a leadership role.

· 7+ years’ experience in eCommerce and retail, in an analytical and/or website development function

· Experience leading a high performing team of senior professionals.

· Experience working with eCommerce software platforms and related platforms (search, etc.)

· Working knowledge of HTML, CSS, Javascript

· Experience working with and driving actionable insights from web analytics platforms such as Omniture and/or Google Analytics

· Familiarity with usability testing methodologies and processes

· Ability to execute against multiple projects and excel in a fast-paced, results-oriented work environment.

· Demonstrated leadership skills in planning and execution

· Strong analytical skills

· Strong organizational, communication and presentation skills

· Ability to easily understand and to be understood

· Advanced leadership coaching and mentoring skills

· Demonstrated business and financial acumen

· Very strong executive presence with a demonstrated ability to navigate difficult situations through relationship building and influencing others

title: DevOps Cloud Specialist
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Rogers has an exciting opportunity if you are passionate about technology. Be a part of a dynamic team responsible for driving forward our portfolio of brands while championing DevOps across the organization. Aside from your technical skills, you’re a leader that’s passionate about DevOps and enjoy coaching others and spreading the culture. As a Senior Cloud Operations Engineer, you will mentor other team members and collaborate with cross-functional teams across IT to plan for and maintain a cost effective, high performing, highly available and scalable cloud infrastructure. This is a unique opportunity to work with leading-edge technologies in a fast-paced environment within a large organization.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • 24/7/365 rotational on-call production support to ensure delivery of first-class service and support to customers.
  • Provide mentorship, guidance and leadership to the team and other team members.
  • System and application management in production and non-production environments.
  • Full stack monitoring, alerting and troubleshooting including network, storage, OS, compute, services & applications.
  • Monitor patches from vendors and apply pro-actively within the assigned environment
  • Incident management including root cause analysis and remediation.
  • Security and compliance management with centralized logging, threat analysis and remediation.
  • Proactive system analysis, tuning and optimization.

QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Passion for emerging technologies and love keeping up with the latest technology trends.
  • Customer centric, and realize the value of providing excellent customer service.
  • Proven leadership skills and the ability to motivate teams. Exceptional abilities at mentoring and engaging others, empowering teams and inspiring them to excellence
  • Strong written and oral communications skills and the ability to communicate with all levels of users/management
  • Strong organization skills, interpersonal skills and excellent attention to details
  • Ability to understand and apply new technologies with a strong desire to learn and improve
  • Ability to effectively prioritize, make decisions, solve problems and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment
  • Ability to work independently and within a team on multiple simultaneous tasks within a challenging fast paced customer-oriented environment.
  • Thorough understanding of Internet architectures;
  • 5+ years’ System Administration experience in a large-scale, multi-OS (Linux/Windows), high-availability environments
  • 3+ years’ experience with Microsoft services and configuration: IIS, Active Directory & SQL Server
  • 3+ years’ experience working with Oracle WebLogic and Database
  • 3+ years’ experience with cloud computing in AWS or Azure
  • 1+ years’ experience with big data technologies: Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Play / Akka, Oracle Golden Gate
  • Experience setting up and regularly using monitoring, trending and logging tools (HP Operations Management, Oracle Enterprise Manager, Dynatrace, DataDog, Azure Diagnostics, AWS CloudWatch)
  • Experience with revision control systems and usage for managing systems configuration: Git, SVN etc.
  • Experience with managing, operating and monitoring backup systems
  • Familiarity with fundamental networking/distributed computing environment concepts; can configure SMB/NFS, key-based auth; DNS; familiar with basic networking concepts: switching, routing, OSI network layers, firewalls, load-balancing at various layers, SMTP, HTTP, SSL, SSH, AD, LDAP, VPN
  • Understanding of programming and scripting languages (Bash, Python, Java, Ruby)
  • Understanding of containerization & orchestration: Docker, CoreOS, Kubernetes, auto-scaling and self-healing systems.

title: Android Developer
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Who we are

We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate.

Mobile Developers at Rogers are passionate about native mobile app development and have a proven track record. They have experience developing for Android and know the ins and outs of Google’s version of Java, the associated APIs.

What we want you to do

We are looking for a Mobile Android Developer who will be a critical member of a new, forward-thinking, Digital IT team. You will develop native mobile apps on Android that will respond quickly to user actions, have low power requirements and include functions that enable flawless, customer friendly user experience. You will creatively produce interfaces that are not constrained by small form factors and work well on larger tablets. This role is based out of our downtown office but may expand to Brampton as well.

The nuts and bolts

  • Prior development experience in Java for web applications
  • Create native applications for Android from cradle to grave
  • Work with developers and architects to create services that can be called without incurring excessive data use
  • Initial unit testing of features in native mobile apps after they are developed
  • Work closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of native mobile applications so that they produce usable designs
  • Agile development experience

    Who you are

  • A university graduate with a degree in engineering or computer science
  • You have 3-5 years of experience in building native mobile apps
  • Knowledge of Android Java and the APIs associated with each of these
  • You’ve demonstrated your ability to create native mobile applications

title: Director, Credit Risk and Collection
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Director, Credit Risk and Collections

Credit Operations is looking for a dynamic, influential and results driven leader as Director of Credit Risk and Collection reporting directly to the Vice President, Credit Operations. This is an excellent opportunity for promotion ready individuals or those seeking a lateral move to broaden experience and demonstrate leadership agility. The successful candidate will lead a large highly engaged team responsible for developing and managing credit risk and collection policies and strategies, involuntary churn and retention tactics and performance management across the Credit Operations organization. The Director will work in partnership with peers across the EBU, CBU, MBU, Finance and the Customer Experience teams to achieve financial, subscriber and customer experience results.

What You Will Be Doing

• Define and deliver CBU and EBU credit risk strategies that achieve subscriber growth and improve financial results

• Actively engage / collaborate with leaders across the business to establish effective policies

• Drive credit system(s) and process improvements across all channels

• Secure executive alignment and approvals (including capital requests) as needed

• Establish Credit Risk and Collection operating plans and 3 -5 year strategic roadmap

• Continually review and enhance credit risk and collection models and decision trees to improve results

• Drive continuous improvement through regular iterative policy changes (champion challenger)

• Develop and manage effective and efficient collection timelines by utilizing voice, SMS and eMail strategies that maximize payment resolution rates

• Work with CBU, EBU and finance teams to establish involuntary churn targets, track performance and take action where necessary to deliver results

• Work closely with the operations to establish and execute involuntary churn retention strategies

•Track and monitor key credit risk and collection performance against plan, and present results to senior management with action plans for improvement

• Build a high performance team by driving team empowerment, engagement and collaboration through focused coaching and development

What You Bring

• Post-secondary degree in Math, Economics, Business or related discipline

• Minimum 3 years at the Director level is preferred

• Minimum 5-7 years of progressive cross functional experience leading large teams

• Demonstrated track record delivering results while managing complex competing demands

• Strong communicator with an ability to influence key stakeholders at all levels in the organization

• Strong collaborator and relationship builder living the Rogers values

• Strong business sense and acumen for financial results

• Strategic thinker who is keen on driving continuous improvement

• Ability to drive and manage change

Nos conseillers aux ventes se passionnent non seulement pour les technologies de pointe et le contenu auquel elles donnent naissance, mais ils en font leur pain quotidien. Nous sommes à la recherche de conseillers aux ventes accueillants et accessibles qui possèdent une solide expérience en vente afin de pourvoir des postes à temps partiel dans notre magasin de Place Laurier # 5257.   • Vous savez atteindre des objectifs de vente individuels.

job_detail:

Reporting to the Manager - Damage Claims & Operations Support (DCOS) the successful candidate will be experienced in complex damage liability and general investigations. The candidate must have a demonstrated ability to be a team player, experienced at multi-tasking, and able to work under tight timelines. Excellent communications skills – both written and verbal are essential. Ability to prepare detailed investigation reports in a timely manner for submission to various management and judicial proceedings. The candidate must be able to: demonstrate professionalism and objectivity under all circumstances; be capable of taking initiative; function in an independent manner, be able to establish effective relationships with key internal and external partners; and, be one of the points of contact with various government and non-government agencies. The candidate will have the ability to work outdoors (construction sites) under adverse weather conditions and be on call on a rotational basis.

Responsibilities Include

  • Conduct and lead a variety of damage, liability (first and third party) and general investigations utilizing established investigative procedures and techniques to Rogers Communications’ (Rogers) property;
  • Assist in damage awareness and prevention aspects of Rogers’ risk management activities;
  • Liaise between Rogers and various agencies (government and non-government) with respect to investigations, and develop and maintain a strong and productive working relationship with those agencies;
  • Ensure that accurate, timely and detailed documentation is prepared, to standards acceptable to the courts, to facilitate effective and efficient investigations and results;
  • Conduct special projects as requested by Management;
  • Assist the Manager, DCOS Unit with the preparation of periodic reports to Management;
  • Represent the DCOS on committees and/or focus groups as required;
  • Identify and share new damage/liability trends, and significant control weaknesses or deficiencies identified during the course of investigations;
  • Develop and maintain a network of internal & external contacts, including key personnel within other utilities, to assist Rogers with damage investigations and prevention;

Qualifications:

  • Minimum of fifteen (15) years of experience in the area of investigating damage, liability, telecommunications investigations (first and third party) or related experience;
  • Demonstrated ability to conduct effective interviews with witnesses, and any other persons connected to events;
  • Thorough knowledge of the judiciary system, namely civil processes and the rules of admissibility of evidence;
  • Demonstrated ability to make independent, sound decisions within tight time frames that reflect depth of knowledge;
  • Ability to negotiate damage settlements with insurance companies and other parties responsible for damaging Rogers’ property.
  • Ability to prioritize workload to meet deadlines and priorities;
  • Ability to interact in a positive manner with contractors;
  • Ability to work in a team environment and contribute to a positive working environment;
  • Ability to facilitate meetings and present publicly to groups ranging from four to twenty individuals;
  • Creative initiative-taker in seeking optimum solutions to a problem;
  • Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, Power Point, CRM;
  • Ability to acquire skills with internal IT applications and systems used by the DCOS Unit;
  • Ability to work under all types of weather conditions;
  • Ability to work independently with minimal supervision;
  • Ability to be on-call and work overtime/ flexible shifts in the evening and on weekends when required.
  • Knowledge of Telecommunications Network an asset.

Requirements

  • The position is based in Brampton (8200 Dixie Road) and travel within Ontario and may require some travel outside of Ontario;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to write clear and concise reports;
  • Must possess a valid Ontario driver’s license and have a good driving record.

  • Knowledge of Locates and the Locate process.

title: Network Specialist
job_detail:
At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. This position provides operational support for Data, Voice and Entertainment platforms, the Corporate and Wireless networks, and to the NOC. It includes the configuration and provisioning of access network devices in the Wireline Access Network. The areas of responsibility are; IP Management, Configuration Management and Capacity Augmentation with focus on IPv4/IPv6 management and switch and port assignments for optimum performance and within capacity constraints.

Expectation of Role
You will be expected to be proactive in developing/contributing techniques and processes to effectively manage and support the devices and services end to end. This involves both hardware and software, from a security and daily operational perspective to ensure consistency with industry standards, internal policies and forward looking precautions.

Responsibilities

  • Provide support with the commissioning, provisioning, and proactive maintenance of core and access network components of all services.
  • Provide technical support on problem service outages.
  • Actively participate in all projects related to the services Provisioning Operations supports; such as upgrades, modifications, augmentations and new service introduction.
  • Proactively monitor provisioning faults for root cause determination and recommendations based on findings.
  • Achieve a high level of security on platforms managed by Provisioning Operations, by minimizing the vulnerabilities and by following guidelines from the vendors, engineering and the Network Security team.
  • Develop and review all MOP’s (Method of Procedure) prior to any change control activities to ensure impact to customers is minimized. Work with other functional groups such as the NOC and other platforms (Network Planning, Management & Control Network, IP Core Server Operations) to review and approve proposed change activities.
  • Develops all documentation including methods of procedure, methods of restoration, backup procedures. Adhere to all policy and legal requirements under Health and Safety legislation.


Key Accountabilities

  • Ensure all customer data and information is secure from all unauthorized person(s).
  • Ensure best interest of Rogers and its business is prioritized.
  • Ensure risks associated with business or service is mitigated to highest degree of control.
  • Ensure all documentation such as but not limited to MOPs are complete with all relevant information and is reviewed by senior specialist prior to implementation.
  • Ensure system access policies are adhered to, acquiring exemption authorization where needed.
  • Ensure all policies and standards listed in Rogers’ literature are met and adhered to at all time.
  • Ensure business requirements are prioritized when on-call.
  • Ensure service delivery and customer satisfaction.
  • Ensure minimal, if any impact to customer service or the business when making changes in the network.
  • Ensure support is available from senior specialists if and when need arises thus minimize risks.


Qualifications

  • Must have a technical college diploma or university graduate in a technology discipline (Computer Science, Computer Networking, Electrical Engineering).
  • Must have a technical understanding of TCP/IP and subnetting.
  • Must have experience with Cisco UBR10K, RFGW10 and Nexus Switch devices. Experience with CASA devices is an asset.
  • Must have experience with networking, Cisco and Juniper routers and UNIX servers such as SUN or HP.
  • Must have a minimum of five years’ experience in Cable, Telecommunications or Internet in a Network Operations or Network Engineering environment.
  • Must be experienced in process development.
  • Must be proficiency with Microsoft Office, Visio and MS Project.
  • Core values; customer focus, team work, communication, accountability and innovation.
  • Role Specific Competencies; integrity, adaptability, problem solving, achievement orientation, listening, understanding and responding.

  • Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.

title: Development Manager- Integrated Sports
job_detail:
At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.

The Manger, Development – Sports & NHL is responsible for driving media sales growth across all platforms through the creation of integrated solutions for our partners (agencies and advertisers) and strategic sponsorship opportunities for the western market.

This role will be part of but not limited to the Rogers Sports Sales team reporting directly to Director, Integrated Sales – Sports & NHL and is based in Vancouver B.C. This role will also work cross-functionally to support various sales teams across Rogers Media. This individual will help conceive ideas, gather assets, create engaging sales material and support sales in presenting solutions to agencies and advertisers. They must understand Sportsnet’ s content, rights and how we can monetize all available platforms within the boundaries of secured agreements. They must establish productive relationships with internal Sportsnet areas, including Content, Media Planning Inventory and Consumer Marketing. They should model an energetic, positive attitude that helps build and foster a “winning team” environment.

Responsibilities:

Planning and Strategy

  • Work with Content, Marketing & Brand and MPI on annual sales plans for all properties across the various platforms.
  • Evaluate and translate property rights across platforms into selling guidelines by property in tandem with MPI team.
  • Manage and maintain annual sales calendar with go-to-market timelines.
  • Conduct semi-annual competitive analysis on best practices in branded content/media from around the world – with emphasis on sports properties.
  • Provide initiative on new and existing business opportunities
  • Ensure timely and accurate information is distributed to sales relevant group(s)

Outbound Initiatives

  • Responsible to create/build/complete “market ready” outbound integrated/multi-platform customer-ready proposals & roadshows with a specific focus on the western market,
  • Ensure outbound opportunity planning and execution cycle is aligned to customer planning and buying windows.
  • Work closely with MPI, Consumer Insights, Marketing, Production and other areas to ensure Sportsnet delivers compelling opportunities to our customers.
  • Become the voice of sales & customer with internal groups - ensuring pricing, packaging and content integration will align with market needs/planning.

Inbound RFPs

  • Responsible for the creative response for all qualified Sportsnet “RFP’s” (request for proposal).
  • This includes ideation (concept creation), preparation of the proposal including the marketing of the proposal.
  • Must prioritize all RFP’s and set up appropriate meetings and brainstorms with the internal groups.
  • Summarizes creative concepts and seek approval from content leads and work with MPI on pricing and category concerns.
  • Develop supporting work-back schedules and mock-ups to help provide a “turn-key” solution for our customers.
  • Create the final customer PowerPoint presentation/sales materials, ensuring customer objectives are met, creative concepts are articulated clearly and include supporting research/creative/sales tools (if required).
  • Be available to present the final solution with sales lead as required.

Reporting and Analysis

  • Maintain revenue tracking by against each “outbound” property as deals close.
  • Track of all in-bound RFPs with details including customer, deal revenue, annual increase (if applicable) and other feedback.
  • Provides post-analysis of key outbound and inbound customer programs

Other Responsibilities

  • Travel to various client meetings, onsite production, client hosting and etc. as needed
  • Schedule regular reporting meetings and updates with the Director, Integrated Sales – Sports & NHL
  • Other duties as required

Qualifications:

  • Core Competencies: Customer Focus; Teamwork; Communication; Accountability; Innovation.
  • Post-secondary degree or diploma
  • 4-6 years of related work experience in an integrated sales and sponsorship marketing capacity
  • Knowledge of MS Office applications
  • Able to multi-task in a fast paced environment
  • Highly motivated individual with excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
  • Strong organizational skills

title: Angular Developer
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Imagine working for an exciting entrepreneurial company whose employees are committed to meeting the big challenges and making a real difference. That’s Rogers. A leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. Right now we are looking for talented individuals to join our winning team where you will have a chance to innovate, grow and to do what really matters. This role will be primarily based Downtown but may expand to Brampton office.

We are currently seeking unusually talented and highly versatile front-end developers who live and breathe HTML 5, CSS and JavaScript and either love or are willing to try a long term relationship with Angular.js or React.js, with a bit of dabbling in other JavaScript frameworks from time to time. You ideally believe that single page applications are the future of Digital and are eager to work with server side developers to ensure they produce well designed REST services for you to consume. We strongly value deep technical skills, an eye for UI design and UX intuition, willingness to learn, and desire to work in an intensive, highly productive environment.

Primary Function:

Develop interactive web applications (in a CMS or single page applications) that include browse, shop and self-service functions and customer friendly capabilities. A key responsibility is to use your creativity to produce highly responsive and enjoyable web-based user interfaces. The customer should never be confused about what is happening or become frustrated because they don’t know what to do next.

Detailed Responsibilities include:

- Creating highly interactive single page applications using Angular.js and React.js that respond to all user actions in fractions of a second

- Creating attractive experiences in content management that delight and inspire the customer

- Creating, maintaining, debugging and optimizing JavaScript, HTML and CSS

- Taking an active role in structuring our single page applications to make them easy to maintain and to ensure they are highly modularized

- Creating optimized HTML, CSS and JavaScript with breakpoints that work well on mobile browsers

- Working closely the architects and back end services team to ensure that that we have a useful set of REST services

- Working closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of single page applications and development frameworks so that they produce usable designs

Qualifications

- A university degree in arts, design, engineering, science, math or computer science is highly desirable

- Experience in JavaScript, jQuery, CSS 3, and HTML 5 and in optimizing for fast rendering

- 5+ years experience in building mobile responsive pages with JavaScript frameworks

- Experience with Social Media APIs (Facebook, Twitter, etc)

- Development using Scrum Agile methodologies is a plus

- Demonstrated ability to create single page applications, either through prior experience, school projects or special websites you have built to showcase your skills

- You truly love to code and build Digital experiences as evidenced by prior projects and experience

- Strong organizational and estimation skills

- Exceptional communications and presentation skills

At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.

Sales Associate

Our Sales Associates make every customer feel welcome and leave delighted, more knowledgeable, and feeling better about Rogers and Fido every time. They know how to engage, show they care and invest the time with our customers to get things done. They want every customer sharing their experience and always coming back.

At Rogers, retail has impact, and so can you.

In this role you will:

  • Deliver a superior and consistent customer experience
  • Be the first to learn about new products and services
  • Handle all issues and concerns – you're the one-stop resolution for our customers
  • Meet and exceed monthly sales targets
  • Work in a fast-paced environment that requires a high degree of multi-tasking
  • Work with and through others to achieve team goals in a highly collaborative environment
  • Be able to work a varied and flexible schedules (Monday – Sunday)

You are someone who:

  • Knows how to greet and thank our customers – you want everyone to feel welcome and appreciated
  • Has a knack for building rapport – you genuinely care about our customers’ needs. It’s not just about the sale!
  • Ensures our customers understand our products and services
  • Enjoys solving customer problems – you take accountability for their issues
  • Is comfortable taking action, showing initiative and feels empowered to lead
  • Takes pride in their work environment and wants to see the team succeed
  • Acts as a brand ambassador, an educator, a leader, a problem solver, and so much more!

Benefits for you:

  • We invest in you, just as much as you invest in us
  • Base hourly rate and competitive commission structure
  • Opportunities to grow and develop your career
  • Strong internal development programs
  • Comprehensive health and dental plan for full time and part time employees
  • Outstanding share options and wealth accumulation programs
  • Employee discounts across Rogers & Fido services
  • Overtime pay eligible

As part of the recruitment process, candidates will be required to provide consent for and successfully pass a criminal background check.

Schedule: Part Time
Shift: Variable
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 519 Westmorland Road (5171), Saint John, NB
Travel Requirements: None
Posting Category/Function: Retail (In Store / Hourly) & Sales and Service
Requisition ID: 106927
WHY ROGERS?
As a proud Canadian company, we're dedicated to making things easier for our customers. We’ve been embracing and leading change for over 50-years, and we’ll continue to seek out new opportunities to bring our customers simple solutions for today and tomorrow.
We recognize that success is determined by the strength and diversity of our people. We work together because we want to win together, and these five shared values guide and define our work:
  1. Simplify and innovate
  2. Take ownership of the what and the how
  3. Equip people to succeed
  4. Execute with discipline and pride
  5. Talk straight, build trust, and over deliver
Why Rogers? Because your tomorrow inspires our today.
What makes us different makes us stronger. Rogers has a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion. Everyone who applies for a job will be considered.

job_detail:
Alors que vous pensez à ce qui s’en vient, n’oubliez pas que nous formons une équipe unie poursuivant un objectif commun : mieux servir nos clients.

Nos conseillers aux ventes se passionnent non seulement pour les technologies de pointe et le contenu auquel elles donnent naissance, mais ils en font leur pain quotidien. Nous souhaitons que les membres de notre équipe soient enthousiastes à l’égard de nos produits et services, et qu’ils veuillent partager leurs connaissances et leur expérience avec les autres. Chez Fido, les Ventes au détail jouent un rôle important… tout comme vous.

Nous sommes à la recherche de conseillers aux ventes accueillants et accessibles qui possèdent une solide expérience en vente afin de pourvoir des postes à temps partiel dans notre magasin de Fido - Centre Valleyfield. Avantages pour vous

  • Taux horaire de base et système de commissions concurrentiels

title: OMNI- Reporter/Présentateur (Italien)
job_detail:
Chez Rogers, nous vous aiderons à mener une carrière fructueuse. Que vous soyez développeur, analyste ou conseiller, vous serez ici au bon endroit pour concrétiser vos idées. Nous acceptons le changement et nous trouvons des moyens de faire mieux. Nous respectons cet engagement en offrant à nos employés une culture d’entreprise basée sur la passion et l’innovation.

Êtes-vous au fait des enjeux importants de la communauté italienne au Canada? Êtes-vous en mesure de dénicher les vidéoclips dont vous avez besoin pour réaliser des reportages à propos d’histoires pertinentes et fascinantes? Communiquer sur les réseaux sociaux est une deuxième nature pour vous? Si c’est le cas, vous êtes peut-être la personne qu’il nous faut. Nous lançons un bulletin de nouvelles national sur OMNI Television partout au pays afin d’offrir du contenu multilingue fascinant et pertinent aux Canadiens. En tant que professionnel chevronné de l’information, vous savez quel type de contenu est apprécié de nos téléspectateurs et vous êtes en mesure d’offrir un contenu captivant. Innovateur, vous savez comment mettre l’accent sur la créativité plutôt que sur la tradition.

OMNI est à la recherche d’un reporter et présentateur (italien) qui fait preuve de passion, de fiabilité et d’initiative. Vous pouvez travailler tant seul qu’avec les membres d’une salle de presse diversifiée. Vous serez chargé de travailler sur des nouvelles en studio et sur le terrain pour plusieurs plateformes de média.

Votre rôle :

  • Présenter les nouvelles nationales italiennes
  • Effectuer des recherches, aller à la rencontre de nouvelles intéressantes, les rédiger, et les présenter en ondes pour le bulletin de nouvelles local et national en mettant l’accent sur du contenu destiné à la communauté italienne
  • Se tenir au fait des événements récents et des enjeux importants au sein de la communauté italienne
  • Utiliser les réseaux sociaux comme une plateforme promotionnelle afin d’inciter les téléspectateurs à regarder nos nouvelles émissions et comme un outil de narration pour mobiliser notre public
  • Mettre à jour les segments durant le bulletin de nouvelles lorsque nécessaire et produire des versions distinctes pour les émissions d’affaires publiques locales
  • Participer aux rencontres quotidiennes relatives au contenu et à la programmation, et contribuer aux remue-méninges créatifs portant sur le nouveau contenu, notamment au développement du contenu de marque
  • Développer et maintenir un réseau de contacts pour les entrevues
  • Écrire des textes d’actualité captivants et exacts pour toutes les plateformes, notamment les préambules, les sous-titres, les intercalaires et les textes promotionnels
  • Suivre toutes les sources d’actualité afin de bien connaître les dernières nouvelles et les situations en évolution
  • Participer à la couverture des nouvelles de dernière heure, notamment aider à coordonner des couvertures en direct, préparer des entrevues pour la diffusion et se procurer des images et des vidéos pour toutes les plateformes
  • Effectuer des recherches et organiser des entrevues pour des reportages et des émissions, au besoin
  • Remplacer les chefs d'antenne lorsque nécessaire, et travailler plusieurs quarts, dont les soirs et les week-ends

Vos compétences :

  • Maîtrise de l’italien, à l’oral et à l’écrit
  • Au moins une à deux années d’expérience en radiodiffusion dans le domaine des nouvelles
  • D’excellentes aptitudes de présentation en ondes, en particulier durant des reportages en direct hors studio et pendant des moments d’improvisation
  • Connaissance de la culture, des besoins et des sensibilités de la communauté italienne
  • Expérience de la rédaction, du montage et de la réalisation d’entrevues en personne
  • Capacité à réagir promptement, à mener plusieurs tâches de front, à gérer les situations et à respecter les échéances dans un environnement dynamique qui évolue rapidement
  • Bon instinct journalistique, bonnes compétences en écriture, connaissance des événements récents, excellent entregent et grande aptitude à communiquer
  • Sens de l'initiative, dynamisme, créativité, grand souci du détail et capacité à résoudre efficacement les problèmes
  • Capacité à faire ressortir le sens de nouvelles complexes et talent pour écrire de façon juste, claire, concise et vivante
  • Capacité à bien suivre les consignes et volonté de s’adapter à une technologie qui évolue rapidement et d’acquérir de nouvelles compétences en ligne dans un milieu d’activités journalistiques numériques à multiples facettes
  • Accès à un solide réseau de contacts dans la communauté italo-canadienne
  • Présence active sur les médias sociaux et capacité démontrée à produire du contenu stimulant pour les utilisateurs de ces réseaux, notamment Facebook, Twitter, Instagram et YouTube
  • Expérience des technologies de Quantel, un atout.
  • Expérience dans la salle de régie et sur le terrain, un atout
  • Diplôme en journalisme de radiotélévision ou expérience équivalente

title: Server Side Developer - Digital
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Who we are

We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate.

Web Service Experts at Rogers are passionate about coding. You can tell just by looking at their output. They do most of their programming in Java using the Play/Akka framework but are always ready and willing to diversify their portfolio.

If you know Java isn’t coffee, Ruby isn’t a gem and Python isn’t a snake, and you are excited about the prospect of thriving in an intensive, collaborative and productive environment, then you’re in the right place.

What we want you to do

We are looking for a Web Service Expert who will be a critical member of a new, forward-thinking, Digital IT team. Think server-side development, with a keen eye on software craftsmanship and scalable architecture. You will develop robust web services to support a diverse range of common functions including (but definitely not limited to): User signup and registration services, web site administration, entitlement checking, making payments, resetting cable boxes and allocating data between wireless accounts.

The nuts and bolts

  • Write reliable and robust code – bonus points if you know how to use TDD – that uses both non-relational and relational databases
  • Make bullet-proof code and implement proper logging, monitoring and manageability
  • Create lightning-fast web services
  • Solve DevOps problems with our infrastructure team
  • Build systems that manage our deployment pipeline, using tools like Bamboo and Ansible

    Who you are

  • You are a university graduate with a degree in computer science, computer engineering or a related field
  • You and programming go way back, we’re talking more than five years of experience using core Java combined with one of the following Ruby, Scala, Python, C#, C++ or C.
  • Experience with REST API’s
  • You truly love to code and can’t wait to show us what you’ve worked on
  • You have more than five years of experience writing code that uses SQL and relational databases

Travel Requirements: Up to 10%

title: Product Manager, Digital Payments
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Product Manager, Digital Payments

Are you a digital surfer? Do you want to put your problem solving, business strategy and technology experience to the test? Would you like to be part of making the buzzwords “customer experience”, “omni-channel” and “design thinking” come to life? Then keep reading because you might be interested in joining our team.

If you have always wanted to work at an entrepreneurial company where the employees are committed to solving big challenges and making a real difference; then join Rogers. We are a leading communications and media company where people come to do great work. We are looking for an individual who is curious, loves digital, and wants to be part of the team that will push the digital customer experience to the next level.

What we want for you:

We want to support and encourage you to find long-term successes. We want you to explore opportunities that play to your strengths and passions. We value lateral moves as much as vertical promotions – we believe all roles should develop your skills, broaden your experience, and help you build a rewarding and fun career.

What you will be doing:

You are a digital expert who will be focus on the MyRogers Digital Service & Support experience and drive self-serve adoption as the channel of choice for our customers. As the Product Manager, Digital Payments you will be an integral part of executing the Rogers Digital Strategy. You will be a key player in developing and leading the digital service portfolio’s vision and own a specific LOB portfolio from both strategy and execution perspective. The type of digital products include payments (& billing), as well as other innovative ways to drive self-serve adoption and engagement. This will involve:

  • Own & prioritize strategic roadmap for digital payments, including all Customer Journey Related Support Content
  • Develop digital strategies and plans based on business objectives, analytics & insights, metrics, market trends and groomed through the consumer lens.
  • Determine, Report and Analyze Key Performance Indicators to track the impacts of the self-serve initiatives across all channels
  • Lead the digital experience strategy that will contribute to the digital strategy and framework.
  • Drive digital transformation across the organization by translating digital strategies into profitable business models.
  • Identify and lead product portfolio planning (e.g. business case development, operational requirements, cost & pricing analysis, and product scope definition).
  • Practices digital thought leadership, Agile & waterfall methodology, and change management processes.
  • Conducts strategic planning to prepare product roadmaps; proactively identifies changes in the business and technology landscape, and identifying technical projects required to maintain/enhance service levels.
  • Advises, consults and socializes with key stakeholders involved in prioritized initiatives; documents business opportunities, recommends digital solutions and provides timelines and budget impacts.
  • Develop strategies and implement programs that maximize self-serve adoption and Digital NPS, reduce operating expenses, and contain costs.
  • Identifies new business opportunities, product and service enhancements within strategic objectives and influences business decisions with senior management.
  • Conceptualize, develop and define product/project business requirements, & Use case development
  • Intake & manage requests for BAU changes from various cross-functional teams
  • Track and measure efficiency & delivery of all initiatives (impact on business and customer satisfaction) against established targets
  • Engage delivery primes across the organization to ensure the roadmap is achievable
  • Identify potential roadblocks and proactive determination of solutions to be implemented
  • Lead cross-functional meetings and drive collaboration between stakeholders. Drive to provide leadership and direction towards accomplishing goals and taking ownership and responsibility from strategy to execution

Qualifications:

  • Master’s or Bachelor's degree in Business, Technology, Design or equivalent
  • 7+ years of relevant digital experience in a fast paced environment (Telco experience is an asset)
  • Keen understanding of the digital ecosystem, trends and customer needs
  • Ability to think strategic as well as operationally
  • Highly motivated individual with a naturally inquisitive nature
  • Ability to multi-task and manage several projects at once
  • Strong self-management, self-pacing, and organizational skills necessary
  • Strong communication (written and oral) skills and negotiation skills
  • Excellent problem solving and decision making skills
  • Holds self-accountable for achieving established performance objectives
  • Excellent organizational and planning skills
  • Excellent customer service skills and able to maintain positive relationships with internal stakeholders
  • Self-sufficient and ability to operate with autonomy & within a team

Technical Skills:

  • Understanding of technical aspects of web & mobile applications
  • Creative ability with practical application for digital channels
  • Experience in the implementation of web capabilities
  • Experience with all stages of the Software Development Life Cycle including Requirement Gathering and Analysis, Unit testing, Deployment, Maintenance and Support.
  • Ability to document & communicate Business Requirements Document (BRD) & Use cases
  • Experience in conducting and gathering requirements using various techniques such as interviews and JAD sessions with stakeholders, department heads and end users.
  • Conceptual understanding of website infrastructures and processes
  • Intermediate knowledge using Jira/Confluence is highly recommended
  • Intermediate knowledge using Omniture (Adobe Suite) is recommended
  • Experience in process flows using related products (such as MS Visio)
  • Expert knowledge within the Microsoft Office

title: Manager, Procurement Strategy
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Reporting to the Director, Procurement Strategy and PMO, this position is required as a result of determined organizational changes to maximize effectiveness of organization, minimize overlaps of responsibility and reduce handoffs.

This role aims to strengthen the Procurement bench by way of an overall organizational increased span of control and deeper Procurement subject matter expertise.

Further, this function drives deep category strategies and supports closer supplier relationships with strategic suppliers for optimized benefit. This role supports strategy influence, formation and execution for the total annual addressable spend of approximately $4.5B

What You'll Be Doing:

Business Partnering

  • Enable decision making on business solutions by advising on the cost/risk of change benefits, influencing desired outcomes, and supporting business decisions.
  • Interact cross-functionally and partner with key stakeholders, ensuring effective liaison with other teams and functions to share knowledge and best practice.

Demand Management

  • Drive TCO reduction and identify supplier price models.
  • Deliver inputs to budget leading to accurate forecasting whilst ensuring an optimised and fully utilised supplier network and resource structure.
  • Support setting of annual savings targets and related KPI measures with Category Team and business partners tied to the budget.

Stakeholder Relationship Management

  • Responsible for building, maintaining, and enhancing solid relationships with key internal stakeholders across the organization to ensure business needs are being met by assigned suppliers.
  • Partner with key internal stakeholders to ensure goal alignment and effective communication with assigned suppliers.
  • Act as internal consultant to business owners through comprehensive understanding of supplier capabilities, market ecosystem, customer and company needs to identify opportunities to expand existing supplier relationships.
  • Champion assigned relationships with suppliers across the functions, maximizing value through the Rogers supplier network and functional areas
  • Client Interactions
  • Become a point-person for senior level clients.
  • Build the capabilities of the team and its ability to have impact.
  • Deep partnerships with the clients on specific projects and outcomes

What You Bring:

  • Undergraduate education.
  • More than 5-7 years of progressive experience
  • Sound knowledge of contemporary procurement strategies, negotiating frameworks, cost modelling analysis and presentation aptitude within a senior level audience
  • Advanced understanding of the supply market for both goods and services and both direct and indirect procurement practices

title: Territory Sales Representative
job_detail:
At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.

As an MDU Field Sales Representative – GTA West, you will play a pivotal role in the continued stability and growth of our organization, by serving as a front-line representative of the Rogers brand. In this role, you will sell Internet, TV, Phone and SHM services to residential customers within assigned territory comprised of multiple dwelling units (MDU). May perform basic installations as well as auditing to drive product penetration and revenue growth. The primary focus is on developing and maintaining lasting relationships with property management that is conducive to the ongoing sales of Rogers products and services to customers within multi-dwelling units. Utilizes advanced knowledge of products and services as well as sales process experience to maximize sales and effectively work assigned territory.

The Sales Representative’s (Field Sales) performance is critical to Rogers achievement of department and company Targetable Sales Unit (TSU) growth and net gain objectives.

Successful candidates are driven “hunters”, with a strong work ethic, a high degree of integrity and an entrepreneurial and achievement-oriented attitude.

Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions

  • Builds and maintains positive relationships with MDU property management and leasing staff and regularly follows up to ensure Rogers products and services are favorably presented to prospective tenants.
  • Partners directly with MDU property manager/leasing staff in designated territories to drive maximum product penetration and revenue growth. Serves as a sales presence at community or company events as required, interacting with current and potential customers.
  • Demonstrates a consistent record of success in residential canvassing
    sales environment with emphasis on business to consumer sales.
  • Generates and retains TSUs through the acquisition of and retention of customers by using Rogers trained skill sets, programming and technical expertise, and makes the appropriate recommendations for services using consultative sales skills. Implements effective closing techniques to ensure sales goals are achieved.
  • Serves as primary contact for MDU communities, maintaining sales literature supplies and/or any basic supplies.
  • Strategically partners with CMA Account Executives and Sales Managers to increase MDU TSU penetration numbers and customer satisfaction.
  • Through various networking tactics, identifies and contacts customers moving into MDU and makes sales presentations.
  • Builds customer loyalty by effectively resolving any/all customer issues and differentiating Rogers products from those of our competitors and communicating those differences effectively.
  • Maintains client satisfaction and takes ownership throughout the sales cycle.
  • Performs end to end order entry through provided technology.
  • Cold canvasses in assigned territory and makes sales presentation to non-subscribers and existing subscribers for upgrades.
  • Creates and maintains successful interdepartmental relationships.
  • Participates in team sales blitzes, conversions, and new releases; including weekend and evening sales events.
  • Performs audits within assigned territory to reduce and eliminate theft of service in order to drive incremental TSU growth.
  • Completes special projects and/or status reports as requested.
  • Introduces, markets and sells any new services.
  • Updates and reports on all sales activities in assigned territories, or geographical areas.
  • May contact customers through various lead portals and disposition outcome.
  • Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary to maximize customer contact
  • Conducts all business in an ethical manner as outlined in the Field Sales Handbook Standards of Performance and Conduct.
  • Attends and participates in all scheduled team meetings.
  • Maintains current job knowledge through completion of on-going training opportunities, satisfactory skills assessment, and attainment of job related certifications.
  • Performs other duties as required.

Qualifications

Required

  • HS diploma or equivalent
  • 2-3 years of experience preferred in related field
  • Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout organization
  • Ability to work independently to achieve set goals within a strategic plan.
  • Must meet the physical requirements of the job including, but not limited to, the ability to walk and/or travel door-to-door for considerable distances in all types of weather conditions.

Preferred

  • Experience in telecommunications industry desired, installation experience a plus
  • 1 - 2 years of proven Door-to-door/outside sales experience highly preferred.

The successful candidate will be a full-time employee of Rogers and will receive:

• Full training on Rogers products

• An attractive remuneration package includes base pay and commissions

• Car Allowance

• Medical and Dental benefits that begin on day 1

• 50 % discount on all Rogers Communications services

• Access to multiple Wealth-Accumulation Programs

• Tablet and smartphone for business use

Schedule: Full Time
Shift: Flex Time
Length of Contract: Not Applicable (Regular Position)
Work Location: 8200 Dixie Road (101), Brampton, ON
Travel Requirements: Up to 100%
Posting Category/Function: Sales & Door-to-door

title: Senior Manager, Sales Strategy & Performance
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Senior Manager, Sales Strategy & Performance

Senior Manager, Sales Strategy & Performance provides expertise on strategy, process and analytics to support Rogers Bank product performance, while working closely with cross functional Bank and Rogers Communications Partnership (RCP) I teams to bring a fact-based highly analytical approach to decision making. This role will have a high level of impact on long term product P&L;, responsible for managing complex strategic recommendations with senior executives in a fast-paced, highly competitive marketplace.

As the sales ambassador for Financial Services products, the individual must have an intimate knowledge of the product, performance and channels in order to lead and keep the acquisition sales strategy on track, avoiding potential road blocks in achieving the Rogers Bank short and long term goals.

The key mandate of this role is to drive product sales and lead the expansion and integration of Rogers Bank products across all pertinent RCP channels.

Core Responsibilities

Strategy & Planning (35%)

A strategic mindset is required in this role to drive change, interpret performance data and understand external/internal factors in order to provide strategic recommendations to move the business forward.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead the development and definition of short and long-term objectives/targets for Bank acquisition channels, in alignment with the Bank’s overall goals and objectives
  • Lead the development of channel strategies, tactics and action plans with functional leaders to meet the defined objectives
  • Manage the collection and provision of inputs to the budgeting process on behalf of the Bank Sales team, including capital requests. Provide advice to ensure adequate and appropriate resources are budgeted/allocated for execution and to equip the channels to meet their assigned targets and objectives
  • Produce offer management strategic plans in alignment with channel volume and cost objectives
  • Provide recommendations to Bank SLT on acquisition strategies that focus on building a positive customer experience at each point of contact

Leadership (30%)

This successful candidate will need be a strong leader with a proven track record of influencing and motivating all levels of management to achieve common objectives.

Responsibilities:

  • Develop and present Rogers Bank strategic presentations for key partners, leadership and planning forums
  • Increase channel leader accountability for product performance by actively engaging leaders in bi-weekly performance review sessions held with cross functional leadership teams
  • Foster knowledge sharing with Bank Sales & Marketing teams on all aspects of the bank product offering (sales, campaigns, brand, new launches, etc.) by chairing collaborative weekly meetings
  • Work closely with the Bank National Sales Engagement Manager on the creation of new sales concepts and programs to achieve channel results and objectives
  • Leverage appropriate business unit teams to provide expertise and insight on channel strategy to ensure Bank inclusion and alignment
  • Oversee new vendor sales contracts, prior to onboarding new or renewing existing channels/suppliers
  • Monitor spending and financial control. Review variances from the budget and report significant issues to those accountable and responsible for remediation

Analytics (20%)

This role will deliver on short (quarterly), mid-term (yearly) and long-term (+5 year) commitments by actively evaluating sales trends and pre-emptively engaging with channel leaders on tactics when forecasting to performance gaps.

Responsibilities:

  • Oversee the development, implementation, and issuance of timely and complete information/reports/scorecards that provide evidence whether commitments are being fulfilled and objectives are being met
  • Monitor and forecast performance, and provide advice on tactical adjustments when necessary
  • Provide advice to the accountable and responsible team members on the financial implications of projects and the financial consequences of business decisions
  • Lead the development of business cases to recommend outsourcing arrangements for new or expanded acquisitions channels – when such expansion is necessary to meet overall objectives
  • Support ad hoc analysis or business case inputs of channel programs as needed to achieve desired timelines and objectives

Efficiency & Growth (15%)

This role will deliver on commitments by actively evaluating sales trends and removing barriers to success driving sustainable product growth.

Responsibilities:

  • Identify and implement process improvement measures to maximize efficiency and productivity across Rogers and Fido customer life cycles
  • Collaborate with sales teams to share and implement best practices across all segments
  • Ensure sales reporting and compensation plans are in place to support channel key performance indicators
  • Optimize current opportunities while identifying and acting on emerging medium and long term trends
  • Manage acquisition channel COA and ensure programs are delivering desired results and profitability

Skills & Experience

  • Excellent analytical and problem solving skills with ability to define critical issues
  • Confident, transparent and concise communicator
  • Comfortable with detail and ability to summarize information into key insights, establishing linkages to business strategy and objectives while generating ideas to improve business performance
  • Consultative with ability to conceptualize and execute initiatives that drive growth and profitability
  • Self-starter with ability to solve ambiguous / open ended business challenges
  • Effective project management skills and ability to progress multiple projects simultaneously
  • Strong negotiation skills based on a thorough understanding of sales / marketing practices
  • Experience leading and influencing cross-functional teams across the organization
  • Ability to manage internal clients at Senior Manager and executive levels
  • Highly proficient with MS apps (Excel, PowerPoint, OneNote, SharePoint)

As part of the recruitment process, the selected candidate will be required to provide employment references and successfully complete a background check which includes credit and criminal check.

title: Senior Analyst
job_detail:
At Rogers we’re for supporting you on a journey to a rewarding career. Whether you’re a developer, an analyst, or a customer care consultant, Rogers is the place where ideas become reality. We embrace change, and find ways to do better. And we deliver on that commitment by fostering an environment of passion and innovation for all people.

Senior Anlayst, Change Management & Communications (6 month contract)

We plan to overhaul our systems and processes to improve our employee experience. We have partnered with Oracle (Oracle HCM Cloud) to move away from our outdated HR, Time and Payroll systems. Our partnership will allow us to provide employees, leaders, Human Resources and administrators an integrated cloud-based mobile HR solution. The transformation is not just a system implementation; it is a business process transformation that will challenge the way we deliver services. This challenge will allow us to take advantage of best in class functionality; for us and our business.

Transformation is a tall task, but it is one that we are ready for. We are looking for passionate communications and change management leaders, who enable others and challenge themselves to implement simple and innovative solutions for their customers. The Change Management & Communications Sr. Analyst, will participate in the support and implementation the overall HR Transformation initiative as a subject matter expert.

Responsibilities:

  • Create and implement plans that maximize employee engagement and support a comprehensive, timely and seamless transition including:
    • Supporting business and workforce readiness through the establishment and execution of a change and communication strategy;
    • Implementing a unified Human Resources portal that engages, informs and educates employees on our programs and services, in partnership with the Portal Manager
    • Executing strategic change management and communications plans to address, manage and/or influence issues important to HR Transformation project.
  • Work collaboratively with functional leads and other internal partners including Communication, Brand, Total Rewards, Organizational Development, Enterprise Learning and HR Operations to build high impact communication strategies.
  • Ensure the consistent application of Change Management discipline throughout an actionable and targeted change management plans.
  • Participate in requirements gathering sessions and assessing change management, communication and training needs with key stakeholders and actively contribute to discussions based on industry knowledge and understanding of Rogers processes.
  • Work closely with members of the Change Management Team to build and implement effective short term and long term change management, communications and training plans.
  • Attend project status meetings to provide status updates on task execution.
  • Build and update change management materials including communications, training, web property content and collateral such as Microsites, online communities, etc
  • Create and manage measurement systems to track adoption, utilization and proficiency of functional stream changes and overall communication effectiveness.
  • Creates the design, development, delivery and management of communications with a polished and professional output
  • Work closely with Change Management team to drive specific program related deliverables e.g Microsite and employee communications projects and related content

Skills & Experience:

  • 5 years of experience directly related to the duties and responsibilities outlined preferred.
  • Experience implementing change management and/or communications solutions in a technology environment, preferably cloud-based solutions, involving multiple clients, technologies and vendors.
  • Bachelors or graduate degree in Communications, Business, Marketing, HR (with a focus on Change Management/Project Management) or related field.
  • Strong understanding of Human Resource Services, Change Management and Communications delivery.
  • Ability to effectively communicate, clearly expressing ideas and concepts both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to draft relevant content from end to end for project related communications
  • Recognized for the ability to drive the timely resolution of issues.
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines managing multiple tasks.
  • Ability to self-motivate and initiate with minimal supervision, adapt to rapidly changing environment.
  • Experience working with large Technology projects in a large complex environments considered an asset.

job_detail:

At Rogers we are building Next Gen Video TV service that will bring content to our customers in an easy, engaging and great user experience. This is a leadership role within Rogers Consumer Business Unit (CBU), Product Development organization that will give you an opportunity to influence how Canadians watch TV.

What you will be doing:

  • Lead Next Gen Video product development initiatives contributing to delivery of seamless, easy to use, reliable customer experiences.
  • Manage initiatives through all phases including Product Definition, Solution Design, Development, Testing and Deployment
  • Ensure alignment regarding scope, schedule, costs and Go To Market Strategy
  • Manage cross-functional product trials and rollout and determine readiness to hand off to operational teams

  • Superior verbal and written communications skills; demonstrated ability to lead teams

job_detail:

Rogers is seeking a seasoned Data Architecture Manager to join our Data Management & Technology team working out of Rogers Brampton & Toronto Campuses. We are looking for individuals with exceptional business intelligence skills that possesses deep knowledge of the telecom industry to assist our stakeholders with delivering on strategic business decisions. Candidates will lead a team that will develop overall strategy, make tooling decisions and perform Proof of Concept exercises. Candidates must be able to work in a fast paced environment with changing priorities and ambiguity to deliver insightful analyses while working effectively in a collaborative manner with peers in IT, and across functional business groups. Execution is key, and meeting timeline commitments is mandatory.

  • 5+ years of experience managing cross-functional or BI architecture project teams – clients, developers, solutions design, production support, 3rd parties and vendors
  • 1+ years of experience managing Hadoop application architecture, performance tuning and optimization
  • Strong background in Business Intelligence and operations experience with Data warehousing projects and programs
  • Excellent understanding of Data Warehousing lifecycle principles and best practices, with operations experience
  • Excellent understanding of Software Development Lifecycle principles and best practices, with operations experience
  • In-depth understanding of Hadoop Big Data ecosystem and best practices (Hortonworks is preferred), with operations experience
  • Experience working with virtualized and physical environments, including public and private cloud

    • Define/drive DM&T; strategy and roadmap and supporting documents.

      Overall understanding of BI tooling (reporting and analytics / Big Data) and the associated interconnects between tools
