title: Reporter, Punjabi
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Are you in tune with what's important to the Punjabi community in Canada? Can you get the clips you need to report on relevant and engagingstories? Is communicating on social media second nature to you? If so, you might be the right person for us.

We are launching national newscasts on OMNI Television across Canada, to deliver compelling multilingual relevant content to Canadians. As an experienced news professional, you know what content our viewers want and how to deliver compelling stories. As a proven innovator, you know how to emphasize creativity over tradition.

OMNI is looking for a Reporter (Punjabi) who is a passionate and reliable self-starter. You can work independently, but also as part of a diverse newsroom. You will be responsible for working on stories both in the studio, and out in the field for multiple media platforms.

Your Role:

  • Pitch, chase, write, research and present stories on-air for the national and local newscasts with an emphasis on content for the South Asian community
  • Staying up-to-date on current events and issues important to the South Asian community
  • Use social media as a promotional platform to drive viewers to watch our news programs as well as a story-telling tool to engage our audience
  • Update the segments during the newscasts, if necessary, and produce separate version for use for local current affairs show
  • Attend daily content and programming meetings as well as contribute to creative brainstorms on new content including branded content development
  • Develop and maintain news contacts for interviews
  • Write compelling, accurate news copy for all platforms, including story leads, segment leads, bumpers and promos
  • Monitor all news sources and be on top of breaking news and developing situations
  • Assist in breaking news coverage - including helping coordinate live coverage, setting up interviews for broadcast, and sourcing pictures and video for all platforms
  • Research and arrange interviews for news stories and shows when required
  • Back-fill for Anchor shifts as needed, and work multiple shifts including evenings and weekends.

Your Skills:

  • Must be fluent in Punjabi, both reading and writing
  • Minimum of 1-2 years broadcast experience in news
  • Strong on-air presentation skills, with an emphasis on live remote abilities and unscripted material
  • Familiarity with the culture, needs, and sensibilities of the South Asian community
  • Experience writing, editing, and conducting in-person interviews
  • Ability to react quickly, multi-task, handle situations, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
  • Strong news judgment, good writing skills, knowledge of current events, and excellent communication and people skills
  • Self-starter, energetic, creative, detail-oriented, and a problem solver
  • Ability to make sense of complex news stories and the talent to write them in a fair, clear, concise, and lively manner
  • Must be able to take direction well and willing to adapt to rapidly changing technology and new online skills in a multi-faceted digital news operation
  • Possess a solid network of contacts within the Indo-Canadian community
  • Active social media presence with a demonstrated ability to produce engaging content for social media users, including on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and YouTube.
  • Experience with Quantel Technology an asset
  • Control room and field production experience an asset
  • A broadcast journalism diploma or equivalent experience

title: Category Manager, Wireless Core
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Reporting to the Sr. Category Manager of Wireless Core, the Category Manager position is a senior role within the Procurement and Supplier Management department. The successful candidate will be an expert within the spend category and will be quickly be recognized by the Rogers business partner as a valued contributor in helping manage the strategic direction, total cost of ownership and risk. This individual must be an excellent communicator with proven ability to influence at all levels within the organization.

The candidate will have deep knowledge of Wireless Core (EPC / MME), IMS, OSS and Voice Platform equipment and technologies.

Knowledge of traditional and emerging commercial models for the provisioning of these products and services also important.

The successful candidate will be responsible for setting savings targets with a TCO mindset for the spend category and be accountable to working collaboratively with other groups within Procurement and with our business partners in Network to realize those savings through market tenders and negotiations. The individual will need to work across different pillars within the organization to corral and drive the overarching procurement point-of-view and to realize the desired outcomes. The Category Manager will cultivate a strong rapport with key senior technical, business and finance stakeholders / partners based on foundational trust, respect, collaboration, cooperation and help achieving their business objectives. The Category Manager will work closely with senior leaders within the vendor marketplace.

Responsibilities:

  • Creates and maintains comprehensive category strategies based on category historic spend, top suppliers, marketplace intelligence, new entrants, disruptors, issues, gaps, opportunities, innovations, new products, industry trends, competitive intelligence, commercial models, delivery models, best practices, business direction, budget requirements and other factors.
  • Takes full end-to-end ownership of the overarching and integrated spend category strategy to drive category transformation and short / medium / long term saving targets
  • Acts as the primary interface to key category business stakeholders
  • Provide category leadership and direction to business partners and the Sourcing & Supplier Management team. Influences the business with respect to gaining buy-in and alignment on the category strategy
  • Drives relationships with key suppliers
  • Identifies cost savings objectives for the category and drives the total cost of ownership reductions
  • Aggregates demand to leverage Rogers’ scale and scope to drive standardization and cost savings.
  • Ensures procurement cost saving challenges are built into the capital and operating budgets and Procurement’s projects and efforts are aligned to meet budget expectations. Ensures procurement projects and savings are tracked against the budget and targets
  • Manages the analysis of spend data to assist with the identification of sourcing and cost take-out opportunities
  • Assist in additional analytical related activities including but not limited to compliance, catalogue adoption rates, procurement metrics and dashboards, etc.

Qualifications:

  • Deep knowledge of category, market trends and impacts to cost structures
  • 5+ years of relevant work experience in the telecom industry preferably in a Wireless network role (vendor or operator), or managing a network category in a procurement setting
  • University / post-secondary degree required in engineering, computer science, business, commerce or economics. An MBA or M. Eng. is desirable but not required
  • Strong relationship building and business acumen are required. Needs to be able to quickly establish credibility and influence with business stakeholders
  • Excellent interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills. Ability to communicate / present complex topics to executive leaders and to “sell” by influencing their thinking and decisions. Ability to deal effectively with ambiguity and resolve multi-party conflicts to get to the “right answer”
  • Needs to understand the power dynamic within the spend category and create his/her own network for success
  • Must be a motivated self-starter and quick study of complicated technical topics
  • Experience leading high level negotiations for technical products and services
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving skills are required as well as excellent attention to accuracy and detail
  • Proven ability to work in a fast-paced, changing environment
  • Must be able to create comprehensive project plans and execute with discipline
  • Requires proficiency in Microsoft products including PowerPoint, Word, Excel and Project
  • Demonstrated mastery of Strategic Sourcing practices is preferred but commercial savviness is mandatory

As part of the recruitment process, the selected candidate will be required to provide employment references and successfully complete a background check which includes credit and criminal checks.

title: Territory Sales Representative
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

As an MDU Field Sales Representative, you will play a pivotal role in the continued stability and growth of our organization, by serving as a front-line representative of the Rogers brand. In this role, you will sell Internet, TV, Phone and SHM services to residential customers within assigned territory comprised of multiple dwelling units (MDU). May perform basic installations as well as auditing to drive product penetration and revenue growth. The primary focus is on developing and maintaining lasting relationships with property management that is conducive to the ongoing sales of Rogers products and services to customers within multi-dwelling units. Utilizes advanced knowledge of products and services as well as sales process experience to maximize sales and effectively work assigned territory.

The Sales Representative’s (Field Sales) performance is critical to Rogers achievement of department and company Targetable Sales Unit (TSU) growth and net gain objectives.

Successful candidates are driven “hunters”, with a strong work ethic, a high degree of integrity and an entrepreneurial and achievement-oriented attitude.

Primary Responsibilities and Essential Functions

  • Builds and maintains positive relationships with MDU property management and leasing staff and regularly follows up to ensure Rogers products and services are favorably presented to prospective tenants.
  • Partners directly with MDU property manager/leasing staff in designated territories to drive maximum product penetration and revenue growth. Serves as a sales presence at community or company events as required, interacting with current and potential customers.
  • Demonstrates a consistent record of success in residential canvassing
    sales environment with emphasis on business to consumer sales.
  • Generates and retains TSUs through the acquisition of and retention of customers by using Rogers trained skill sets, programming and technical expertise, and makes the appropriate recommendations for services using consultative sales skills. Implements effective closing techniques to ensure sales goals are achieved.
  • Serves as primary contact for MDU communities, maintaining sales literature supplies and/or any basic supplies.
  • Strategically partners with CMA Account Executives and Sales Managers to increase MDU TSU penetration numbers and customer satisfaction.
  • Through various networking tactics, identifies and contacts customers moving into MDU and makes sales presentations.
  • Builds customer loyalty by effectively resolving any/all customer issues and differentiating Rogers products from those of our competitors and communicating those differences effectively.
  • Maintains client satisfaction and takes ownership throughout the sales cycle.
  • Performs end to end order entry through provided technology.
  • Cold canvasses in assigned territory and makes sales presentation to non-subscribers and existing subscribers for upgrades.
  • Creates and maintains successful interdepartmental relationships.
  • Participates in team sales blitzes, conversions, and new releases; including weekend and evening sales events.
  • Performs audits within assigned territory to reduce and eliminate theft of service in order to drive incremental TSU growth.
  • Completes special projects and/or status reports as requested.
  • Introduces, markets and sells any new services.
  • Updates and reports on all sales activities in assigned territories, or geographical areas.
  • May contact customers through various lead portals and disposition outcome.
  • Regular, consistent and punctual attendance. Must be able to work nights and weekends, variable schedule(s) as necessary to maximize customer contact
  • Conducts all business in an ethical manner as outlined in the Field Sales Handbook Standards of Performance and Conduct.
  • Attends and participates in all scheduled team meetings.
  • Maintains current job knowledge through completion of on-going training opportunities, satisfactory skills assessment, and attainment of job related certifications.
  • Performs other duties as required.

  • Qualifications

    Required

  • HS diploma or equivalent
  • 2-3 years of experience preferred in related field
  • Excellent interpersonal, presentation, and collaborative skills to work effectively with teams throughout organization
  • Ability to work independently to achieve set goals within a strategic plan.
  • Must meet the physical requirements of the job including, but not limited to, the ability to walk and/or travel door-to-door for considerable distances in all types of weather conditions.

  • Preferred

  • Experience in telecommunications industry desired, installation experience a plus
  • 1 - 2 years of proven Door-to-door/outside sales experience highly preferred.

  • The successful candidate will be a full-time employee of Rogers and will receive:

    • Full training on Rogers products

  • Car Allowance

  • • Medical and Dental benefits that begin on day 1

  • • 50 % discount on all Rogers Communications services

    • Access to multiple Wealth-Accumulation Programs

    • Tablet and smartphone for business use

title: Mobile Application Developer
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Who we are

We are Rogers, a dynamic Canadian media and telecommunications company. Innovation is our legacy and building a brilliant digital future is our mission. As a leading Canadian company we are passionate about winning and committed to pursuing the best. This translates into everything we do, including the selection of a candidate. Mobile Developers at Rogers are passionate about native mobile app development and have a proven track record. They know how to develop for the iOS platform and have experience with Objective-C. They have experience developing for Android and know the ins and outs of Google’s version of Java, the associated APIs and have some idea as to what “O” stands for. If none of this makes sense to you, you’ve probably clicked on the wrong job posting. But if you understood it all, and are excited about the prospect of thriving in an intensive, collaborative and productive environment, then you’re in the right place.

What we want you to do:

We are looking for a Mobile Developer who will be a critical member of a new, forward-thinking, Digital IT team. You will develop native mobile apps that run on either Android or IOS. These apps will respond quickly to user actions, have low power requirements and include functions that enable flawless, customer friendly user experience. You will creatively produce interfaces that are not constrained by small form factors and work well on larger tablets. This role is based out of our downtown office but may expand to Brampton as well.

The nuts and bolts

  • Development experience in one or more of Objective-C, Swift, or Java
  • Create applications for both Android or iOS
  • Work with developers and architects to create services that can be called without incurring excessive data use
  • Initial unit testing of features in native mobile apps after they are developed
  • Work closely with UX and UI designers to help them understand the constraints of native mobile applications so that they produce usable design

Who you are

  • A university graduate with a degree in engineering or computer science

  • You have 3-5 years of experience in building native mobile apps
  • Knowledge of one or more of: Objective-C, iOS, Swift, Android Java and the APIs associated with each of these
  • You’ve demonstrated your ability to create native mobile applications

title: Directeur, TI, Numérique, Services résidentiels
job_detail:
Alors que vous pensez à ce qui s’en vient, n’oubliez pas que nous formons une équipe unie poursuivant un objectif commun : mieux servir nos clients.

Rogers est à la recherche d’un directeur, TI, Numérique, Services résidentiels qui relèvera du vice‑président, TI, Développement numérique, Expérience client. Le titulaire du poste travaillera a nos bureau situe au centre-ville a Montréal. Il collaborera avec les équipes de direction de l’unité administrative des services résidentiels et fera preuve de leadership éclairé afin d’augmenter les capacités numériques et de concevoir une feuille de route technologique allant de pair avec les stratégies relatives aux produits et aux ventes des services résidentiels. La personne recherchée possède une grande expérience technique du domaine du numérique, en plus d’avoir déjà travaillé à l’élaboration de solutions et de modèles de TI novateurs qui fournissent une excellente expérience numérique du processus de vente en ligne, du libre-service et des capacités liées aux services prépayés. Le candidat retenu possédera de grandes compétences dans le domaine de la technologie numérique et un sens aigu des affaires qui lui permet de produire des résultats. Il pourra diriger en influençant les autres et bâtir des relations solides en collaborant avec des intervenants de tous les échelons de l’entreprise.

Responsabilités clés

  • Élaborer et mettre en œuvre les processus de vente numérique et les capacités du libre-service pour les clients et les conseillers de première ligne, notamment concevoir une plateforme de commerce commune pour tous les réseaux.
  • Élaborer et mettre en œuvre des feuilles de route au sujet d’une stratégie à long terme.
  • Appuyer les priorités quant au perfectionnement du leadership et les changements de culture au sein du service des TI en adoptant un style de travail hautement collaboratif qui permet la mobilisation de toutes les unités fonctionnelles d’affaires.
  • Mettre l’accent sur des stratégies de développement et de déploiement rapides et économiques, dont des méthodes souples.
  • Élaborer et mettre en avant des solutions en préconisant un rendement et une stabilité élevés.
  • Réaliser les engagements visant les projets de l’année aussi bien qu’à plus long terme.
  • Choisir la technologie et les fournisseurs de la feuille de route.
  • Assumer la responsabilité de la mise en place d’une architecture numérique stable et bien définie qui appuie les initiatives des services résidentiels.
  • Diriger l’exécution d’initiatives numériques des services résidentiels en partenariat avec l’équipe responsable du déploiement des capacités numériques.
  • Assurer la clarté et la gestion efficace des exigences relatives à la portée et aux affaires.
  • Soutenir les équipes et écarter les obstacles des projets et des programmes.
  • Évaluer, concevoir, élaborer et gérer des projets de plateforme numérique.
  • Mener à bien des initiatives visant la cote NPS des services numériques, des projets visant la durabilité et l’exploitation, de même que des composantes de soutien à la production, au besoin.
  • Veiller au perfectionnement des compétences des employés ainsi que créer et entretenir une culture et un processus de gouvernance souples.
  • Diriger, gérer et motiver l’équipe en offrant du mentorat et l’encadrement, de même qu’en s’assurant de la production d’un plan de perfectionnement par chaque membre.
  • Élaborer et gérer un budget réservé aux applications, aux projets et aux ressources (conformément aux objectifs en matière de frais d’exploitation et de dépenses d’immobilisations).
  • Planifier, diriger et coordonner la conception, l’élaboration et la mise en œuvre des capacités d’affaires électroniques.
  • Assurer la constance et la facilité de maintenance des applications existantes en respectant et en faisant respecter les normes et les procédures de mise en œuvre de nouvelles solutions.

    Compétences

  • Minimum de dix ans d’expérience, dont au moins trois ans à titre de cadre dans le secteur des TI.
  • Minimum de cinq ans d’expérience dans le secteur des affaires électroniques ou du commerce électronique.
  • Attrait technique marqué pour les technologies numériques et connaissances à jour en la matière, notamment en ce qui a trait au commerce électronique, à l’analytique web, à la recherche, à la gestion de contenu/documents et à la mobilité.
  • Expérience en gestion de programmes d’envergure dont les exigences techniques et fonctionnelles comportent de nombreux éléments.
  • Expérience de travail dans le cadre d’initiatives de grande envergure comportant des livrables mondiaux et régionaux.
  • Aptitude à établir des priorités de manière efficace afin de mettre l’accent sur les initiatives et d’agir en fonction des priorités établies.
  • Excellentes aptitudes pour la résolution de problèmes et la prise de décisions concernant le dépannage.
  • Aptitudes supérieures pour la communication écrite et orale, la négociation et l’animation s’adressant à divers publics.
  • Capacité à résoudre les problèmes, à atténuer les obstacles et à faire en sorte que les équipes soient sur la même longueur d’onde, et ce, de manière constante en adoptant une approche collaborative.
  • Sens de l’initiative et capacité à être productif dans un milieu dynamique avec une supervision minimale.
  • Expérience démontrée de mise en œuvre de plateformes à haut rendement de grande envergure.
  • Baccalauréat en TI, en génie, en sciences informatiques ou expérience équivalente (obligatoire).
  • Expérience démontrée des éléments suivants :
  • Connaissance pratique de technologies de pointe – Angular, Play, Akka, Janrain, Dynatrace, Adobe, Endeca et les systèmes de gestion de contenu Livesite et Teamsite de HP.

    Compétences en leadership et autres compétences essentielles

  • Leader reconnu possédant la capacité de motiver une équipe à obtenir des résultats exceptionnels.
  • Excellent esprit d’équipe et aptitude pour le travail dans un milieu dynamique à forte croissance où la qualité, l’innovation et la vitesse de la prise de décisions et de l’exécution sont essentielles au succès de l’entreprise.
  • Capacité à exécuter de multiples projets et à exceller dans un environnement de travail axé sur les résultats.
  • Capacité d’appuyer et de renforcer la marque et la culture de l’entreprise.
  • Charisme, capacité à surmonter les obstacles, capacité de gérer les situations difficiles et de bâtir des relations grâce à des compétences en négociation.
  • Aptitudes pour le leadership collaboratif et capacité confirmée à marquer et à influencer des intervenants de diverses fonctions et de divers groupes à tous les échelons organisationnels.
  • Aptitude à résoudre des problèmes en mettant l’accent sur les processus; capacité à joindre des concepts et des idées de haut niveau en un tout qui tisse des liens entre les analyses de rentabilité et le travail technique; capacité d’expliquer les avantages et les coûts efficacement.
  • Grand sens de l’initiative, capacité à travailler dans un milieu en constante évolution ainsi qu’à gérer l’ambiguïté et volonté de déployer des efforts pour mettre l’accent sur l’établissement de priorités et l’atteinte de l’équilibre entre les objectifs de multiples intervenants.

title: Director, Fido Wireless IT
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal –serve our customers better.

Rogers is seeking a Director, Fido Wireless IT reporting to the VP, Digital Development, Customer Experience IT. This position will be based out of our Downtown Montreal office. The Director will partner with Fido's Wireless business unit’s leadership teams to provide thought leadership to build out Digital capabilities and a technology roadmap that aligns to Fido's Wireless products and sales strategies. This position requires a person with a strong technical Digital background with experience in creating innovative IT solutions and designs that provide a brilliant digital experience with our online sales flows, self serve, and prepaid capabilities. The successful candidate will possess strong digital technology skills and business acumen to drives results, and has the ability to lead through influence, building strong relationships by working collaboratively with all levels of the organization.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and Deliver the Digital Sales flows, and self serve capabilities for our consumers, and front line reps including a common commerce platform across all channels
  • Develop & deliver long-term strategy roadmaps
  • Support leadership development priorities and IT department cultural changes with a highly collaborative working style that enables engagement across functional business teams
  • Focus on rapid and cost effective development and deployment strategies including agile methodologies
  • Develop and deliver solutions with high performance and stability
  • Deliver both in year and longer term project commitments
  • Select technology and vendors to deliver to roadmap
  • Responsible for the delivery of a reliable, well-defined Digital architecture that supports Fido's Wireless initiatives
  • Govern execution of Fido's Wireless digital initiatives in partnership with Digital Capabilities Delivery team.
  • Ensure scope and business requirements are clear and managed effectively
  • Support teams and remove road blocks on projects, programs
  • Estimate, Design, Build and manage digital platform projects
  • Deliver Digital NPS initiatives, Sustain & Operation initiatives, Production Support items as necessary
  • Develop talent, build and drive an agile culture and governance process
  • Lead, manage and motivate team by mentoring, coaching and ensuring development plans established for each team member
  • Develop and manage a budget for the applications, projects, and resources (deliver against Opex and Capex targets)
  • Plan, direct, and coordinate design, development and delivery of eBusiness capabilities
  • Ensures consistency and maintainability of existing applications by following and enforcing standards/procedures for implementing new solutions.

Key Qualifications

  • Minimum of 10 years’ experience with at least 3 years in a senior IT leadership role
  • Minimum of 5 years’ experience in an eBusiness and/or eCommerce role
  • Strong technical affinity and current understanding of digital technologies including eCommerce, web analytics, search, content/document management and mobility
  • Experience managing large programs with multiple elements of functional and technical requirements
  • Experience working on global initiatives that require both the global and region specific deliverables
  • Ability to prioritize effectively to focus on initiatives and building alignment around what has been prioritized

  • Must have the ability to consistently and collaboratively resolve issues, mitigate roadblocks, and align teams.
  • Must be a self-starter with ability to be productive in a fast-paced environment with minimal direction.
  • Proven track record of successfully delivering large scale high throughput platforms
  • Bachelor's degree in IT, Engineering, Computer Science or equivalent experience (required),
  • Proven experience with the following:
  • Working knowledge of leading edge technologies – Angular, Play, Akka, Janrain, Dynatrace, Adobe, Endeca, and CMS systems: HP Livesite and Teamsite

Leadership Attributes & Other Critical Competencies

  • Proven leader with ability to motivate a team to achieve outstanding results.
  • Extraordinary team player and ability to thrive in a fast-paced, high-growth environment where quality, innovation, speed of decision making and execution are critical to organizational success.
  • Ability to execute against multiple projects; results-oriented work environment.
  • Supports and strengthens the corporate brand and company culture.
  • Executive presence, with the ability to navigate difficult situations and build relationships via persuasive negotiator skills.
  • Collaborative leader with demonstrated ability to impact and influence across various functions and groups at all levels of an organization.
  • Process oriented problem solver who is able to take high level concepts and ideas and create a story that can connect the business case to the technical work and is able to articulate the benefits and cost effectively.
  • Brings a high degree of initiative, is able to work in an ever changing environment, and is able to manage ambiguity and relentless focus on prioritizing and balancing multiple stakeholder goals.

In this role, you will sell Internet, TV, Phone and SHM services to residential customers within assigned territory comprised of multiple dwelling units (MDU). May perform basic installations as well as auditing to drive product penetration and revenue growth. The primary focus is on developing and maintaining lasting relationships with property management that is conducive to the ongoing sales of Rogers products and services to customers within multi-dwelling units. Utilizes advanced knowledge of products and services as well as sales process experience to maximize sales and effectively work assigned territory.

The Sales Representative’s (Field Sales) performance is critical to Rogers achievement of department and company Targetable Sales Unit (TSU) growth and net gain objectives.

title: Sr. Info Security Specialist - Cyber Defence
job_detail:
Every day, we strive to build a brilliant digital future for Canadians. We work as one team, with one goal – serve our customers better.

Reporting to the Senior Manager of Cyber Defence Management, the Senior Security Specialist is part of a team accountable for reducing the probability of technology security incidents at Rogers by means of technical vulnerability assessment, platform configuration compliance enforcement and governance of key security controls to optimize their use for reduction of real world risks to the corporation and its systems.

In particular, this role is expected to have network-centric focus to bolster this team’s capability to identify, assess, mitigate & remediation vulnerabilities & weaknesses in our networks (as opposed to platforms or applications).

On a daily basis, this role will be required to interface with operational teams to build out the vulnerability management program into new areas and help these teams understand the technical risks & severities of the identified gaps on the platforms they manage.

The ability to combine guru-level security knowledge of a range of network equipment types & protocols with solid communication capability to translate these into management comprehensible risks is key to the success in this role. We cannot succeed if the people making decisions about what risks to tackle in what order cannot understand & contextualize the problems we see.

This is not theoretical security, this requires hands-on practical experience that can provide specific guidance to platform & application operators to ensure real world security against likely & plausible threats to Rogers.

Experience & Education

  • Undergraduate degree or equivalent. 4+ years of applied technical experience.
  • General network technical certifications (e.g. CCNA, CCNP) preferred
  • Experience & awareness of a broad set of industry security specifications, standards & regulations such as (but not exhaustive): PCI, SOX, ISO-27001/2, PIPEDA, Canadian financial regulation
  • CISSP or equivalent general security certification desirable
  • Web Application security or penetration testing (GPEN, CWAPT, OSCP) certifications desirable
  • Experience with voice & telecom non-IP based protocols a plus (e.g. SS7)

Technical Skills

  • Works with minimal supervision, while monitoring and executing a number of time critical actions
  • Proven ability to analyze and solve a wide range of technical problems.
  • Detailed operational knowledge of systems relevant to field of work in terms of functionality and capability and/or detailed knowledge of services provided within the related field.
  • Broad technical knowledge suitable to an information security professional: TCP/IP, Unix, Windows, firewall, IPS, database, web application, DDoS, malware, log analysis
  • Project and/or people management skills gained through previous experience, where appropriate.
  • Moderate coding ability suitable to writing shell scripts (BASH, PowerShell, etc.) or SQL queries to simplify unexpected administrative or technical tasks
  • Resolves problems independently and/or through a support team.
  • Strong & clear written, verbal & presentation skills including:
